page.title: 06Astley Vineyards The Crundel
page.content: {by Helen Davis Vineyards introduced to the Severn Valley by the Romans are mentioned in the Domesday Book.The Crundel, a steep south facing sandstone slope at Astley known as the vineyard,probably served the nearby Benedictine priory which existed until the reign of Henry V.On this site off Crundels lane Michael and Betty Bache reintroduced the vine in 1971.After 7 years of experimenting with different varieties three proved suitable for the soil, position and climate.Muller Turgau, Madeleine Angevine and Huxelrebe Kerner is another grape grown there. In 1929 to 1980 this Vineyard was expanded to include the adjoining 4.5 acres. Astley Vineyards have their own fermenting tanks at the Three Choirs Vineyard in Glos. where the process is completed.
